name: 5-(2,4-dichlorobenzylidene)-2,2-dimethyl-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1812
Reason:
The molecule, 5-(2,4-dichlorobenzylidene)-2,2-dimethyl-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione, has a base structure of 1,3-dioxane, which has a melting point of approximately -40°C. Each functional group will modify this base value. It contains a 2,4-dichlorobenzene ring, two methyl groups, and a carbonyl group on the dioxane ring:
- 2,4-Dichlorobenzene: A double bond and two chlorine atoms contribute to the molecular weight and increase intermolecular interactions. Estimated increase of +70°C.
- Methyl groups: Two methyl groups add steric bulk and increase molecular weight, which typically raises the melting point. We can estimate an increase of approximately +20°C for each methyl group together.
- Carbonyl group: Being a polar functional group, it can form hydrogen bonds, thus increasing the melting point. Estimated increase of +50°C.
